I have been in great shape as recently as a year ago but due to a series of injuries and just a lot of "stuff", I've definitely gotten more out of shape than I like. I'd like the scale number to be 10-12 lbs less than it currently is, but I'm more concerned with lean muscle mass and body fat %, than actual weight numbers as I'm one of those people BMI doesn't work for (if I meet that height and weight guideline, I've been told I look scarily ill).

I need someone well qualified, experienced, good track record and with a strong knowledge of nutrition and functional fitness, to get me back on track and keep me accountable.

So someone more personable is definitely a requirement :-).

I live in LoDo and have access to a decently equipped gym. I also have a membership to LoHi Athletic Club that I obviously don't use often enough but it's a gym with 24 hour access. I'm open to other options too. With the right person, I'm very dedicated. I just need to see steady progress to keep from burning out, so shifting goals is key.

title: It's Open....
text:
Hello;
The Re-model/Re-builld of the old Act 1&2 Theater on W. Colfax is open. I was there Tuesday night. It's an "Interesting" design. They Cut an entrance in the Concrete wall that separates the "Book Store" arcade from the old theater and it's the same admission fee...$10...$8 for "Seniors" 60 and over. It's all built from particle board, and painted Black...there's some booths, and, I think 3 or 4 small seating/screening areas, a couple showing gay movies and a couple showing BI/Straight movies, although the movies that were there on Tues. weren't very good. It's not very well built and the way some assholes treat things I don't think it will hold up very well at all. The Drunks/Druggies will have the booth doors torn off, and holes in the walls, not to mention tearing up the seats. There are no doors leading to the Seating areas, and the whole place is something of a maze. While I was there I was the Only one out of probably 8-10 guys that actually sat in the screening rooms, virtually Everyone else just Circled through the place, desparately looking for what, obviously, wasn't there. It, honestly, was Comical, it looked like a track meet!!...They did use New Seats in the place, but they didn't bother to so much as touch the Nasty Rest Rooms...Same mostly broken urinal, sinks that don't work. It's easy to see where the Theater was, as the doors are there, and the old doorways that led into the theaters are in use to the areas of the current place...which are all connected. There are monitors, but it's pretty well impossible to tell what you're looking at, and no way to see if someone is entering the place like the "Act" had...I don't know, maybe they just haven't finished the CC System yet. I'm a bit disappointed in the effort that has been made there. I guess I was hoping for something a bit different and not just another place for wandering lookie loos...I believe their idea was to make a usable place in the space they bought from the former Act proprietors, that would use an entrance from the pleasures store, thereby making it one occupancy, so as to avoid the taxes incurred in operating two occupancies. They accomplished that, but I, personally wish they had spent all that money on a complete renovation of the Theaters, and just made an entrance from the Pleasures store, seems like it would be much more popular and would, in all probability, cost much less...But then, I'm not a businessman...I'm going to go this afternoon, and see what the day crowd is like...I think I probably know, I expect it to be pretty much a carbon copy of the maggotts that haunt the "Circus" constantly cycling around, never sitting down, looking like a parade of lost, desparate souls. The place ought to be billed as an exercise gym, they probably do 10 miles just wandering...Have Fun, Be Careful...Stop By, I'll be sitting in one of the straight, pussy porn screening areas...
